learningContent.title: Adding a topichead to a bookmap

lcInstruction.p: The <topichead> element allows you to specify a title-only entry in a map that applies to one or more topics. The specified title will appear in both the table of contents, if present, and as a header in the main body of the text. The <topichead> element requires one of two things:

ul.li: A navtitle attribute on the <topichead> element

lcInstruction.p: You can use both of these to indicate to your processor that you want to handle the supplied navtitle differently.

This is useful because it allows you to group topics together that are contextually related without implying a hierarchical relationship, and prevents you from having to create a container topic to create a title.

step.cmd: Add a <topichead> element before the <topicref> referencing t_create_table.dita and close it after the <topicref> referencing t_modify_table.dita as follows:

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE bookmap PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA BookMap//EN" "bookmap.dtd"> <bookmap id="ducks"> ... <chapter href="c_duckdb.dita"> <topichead> <topicref href="t_create_table.dita"> <topicref href="t_adding_entry.dita"> <topicref href="t_modify_entry.dita"> <topicref href="t_deleting_entry.dita"> <topicref href="t_queries.dita"> <topicref href="t_modify_table.dita"> </topichead>

step.cmd: Add a navtitle attribute to the <topichead> element that you just created and add content to it as follows:

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE bookmap PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA BookMap//EN" "bookmap.dtd"> <bookmap id="ducks"> ... <chapter href="c_duckdb.dita"> <topichead navtitle="Common tasks"> <topicref href="t_create_table.dita"> <topicref href="t_adding_entry.dita"> <topicref href="t_modify_entry.dita"> <topicref href="t_deleting_entry.dita"> <topicref href="t_queries.dita"> <topicref href="t_modify_table.dita"> </topichead>

step.cmd: Add a <topichead> element before the <topicref> referencing r_tnav.dita and close it after the <topicref> referencing r_modify_table.dita

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE bookmap PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA BookMap//EN" "bookmap.dtd"> <bookmap id="ducks"> ... <topicref href="t_modify_table.dita"> <topichead> <topicref href="r_tnav.dita"> <topicref href="r_add.dita"> <topicref href="r_delete.dita"> <topicref href="r_edit.dita"> <topicref href="r_newtable.dita"> <topicref href="r_modify_table.dita"> </topichead>

step.cmd: Add a <topicmeta> element after the opening <topichead> element you just added and add a <navtitle> element to it as shown:

stepxmp.pre: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE bookmap PUBLIC "-//OASIS//DTD DITA BookMap//EN" "bookmap.dtd"> <bookmap id="ducks"> ... <topicref href="t_modify_table.dita"> <topichead> <topicmeta> <navtitle>Command reference</navtitle> </topicmeta> <topicref href="r_tnav.dita"> <topicref href="r_add.dita"> <topicref href="r_delete.dita"> <topicref href="r_edit.dita"> <topicref href="r_newtable.dita"> <topicref href="r_modify_table.dita"> </topichead>
